discourse_list.title: [Informal Poll] Yearn want to open a big vault to mint ~ 15M, as client

content.content: Do we want to open a specific vault for them with a fix rate?    Do we want to create a specific vault for them?  Yes, great. We need Dai to be generated. No, let’s them minted and sell YFI and go to hell.     0 voters        Which long term rate?  3.5% like RAW 4.5% 6% like all the others 10% go to hell, too risky     0 voters        Term?  6 months 1 year 2 years 3 years     0 voters     I believe that is going to be a good first experience with fix rate. The amount is perfect in term of risk.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking for feedback on whether to open a specific vault for a client and what the long term rate and term should be. The post also includes a poll for users to vote on their preferences. The post does not advertise the proposal, nor does it contain entirely positive or negative feedback.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: I think allowing Yearn to mint DAI using YFI is a good (and profitable) thing we can do for the community. However, I have two concerns.   Does creating a YFI-X vault type require significant dev resources? Would we be able to bring it up in time for Yearn to benefit?   I am not sure the additional commentary on some of the poll options is appropriate for a signal request. Also multiple choice voting might be preferable.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: This is a great experiment!  Lower stability fees are fine with the assurance that Yearn will manage this vault like yETH.
In my opinion 6 months would be too short… Think about 1 year with 3.5RAW would be the best fit …
The rate here is more as an indication. Risk management should assess it.
I think one year is appropriate, and the SF indicator should be the same as other token indicators.

Assuming the YFI community does choose Maker as a lender — I believe they only need a short-term loan per a few comments  @banteg made on Rocket Chat. It’s possible other outlets might step in with offers at lower rates/better terms. Assuming there is appetite for such risk.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: personally speaking, if it doesn’t scale, it isn’t worth the scarce bandwidth of governance.

Hi There, Removed the signal request tag as it isn’t and add sentiment. A proper pool will be added further. I think we reach the general sentiment (100% yes with 15 votes) and a more constructive plan needs to be discussed with both parties.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
None of the topics listed match

content.content: it’s fixed rate, so i don’t assume much governance is needed? I assume there should not be much work for smart contract team, oracle etc it would be good marketing for Maker  It’s mostly about risk and rate.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: no dispute on any of your points with one catch. in my eyes, governance should ** start **to have minimum usage targets. Eg 50MM in one year. and if those targets can be reached, it may be time to remove the collateral type and ensure scarce risk and governance resources are directed at scale opptys.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I disagree with the fact that doesn’t scale. Yearn is looking for fresh capital and at the end of the day they are a sort of hedge fund. I am sure they will be happy to borrow 500M if we let them doing it. For me it looks more a RWA with an already existent on-chain token. I am not sure if they have an actually entity but I believe they do.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I dont know how big it will be… my point is reference the desire to ensure a minimum over a period of time… (not what it will be to start)… regardless of the collateral. for example, no disrespect to BAL… however with 780k debt outstanding… the DAO is probably paying more in gas fees for the oracle than revenue and when the risk is included i suspect it is a net upside-down engagement (though I am ignorant on the gas… it is just an impression)… and the time that its takes to eval the risk isnt “free”.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match
None of the topics listed match

content.content: We already have a YFI vault, no oracle feed needs to be added.

While i agree we should define some minimum (relative) threshold where does not make sense to onboard, we should probably treat this differently. We can get few 100k of fees in a year for not much work and additional risk. Imo such 15m it’s not worse than 50m with a lot of new work/risk. But, yeah. I agree.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: mrabino1:  personally speaking, if it doesn’t scale, it isn’t worth the scarce bandwidth of governance.   I kind of agree. But here I think it is worth doing this, even for just 11m DAI, as a first experiment. The experiment: set up a Vault type accessible by just 1 individual/user/entity (i.e., restricted). A private line of credit, sort to speak. This is motivated, of course, by the fact that this individual is particularly trustworthy. In the future, if it works, we might do this at a much much larger scale with other organisations.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I am all about testing… all about bringing on new collateral… but at some point, we need to “call it” on collateral that is economically upside down (none should be sacred).
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal.

content.content: Yes. But another route, to follow in parallel, is to expand the limited resources of MakerDAO and increase the Risk/Oracles/SC Core Units.
@alexis I think it would be important to vote on the collateralization ratio as well. Was there one you had in mind?

I believe the rate/term/collateralization/repayment facility/amount needs actually to be discussed between both parties like a bank would do. We have a rate team that should be about to assess it. All those parameters can change depending of the others. The main thing is that the sentiment is positive about it on our side. Over all it is like having two bank entities - a private bank and a retail bank. Which is what we tried to do indirectly with RWA.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: alexis:  I believe the rate/term/collateralization/repayment facility/amount needs actually to be discussed   Understood. I was just trying to say that its’ difficult to vote for the rate (which is in the poll) without knowing the CR.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Gotcha, That was my mistake, do I need to remove the rate poll?

Need? Definitely not my place to say, that’s @LongForWisdom  I was just saying that personally I don’t know how to vote for the rate without also voting for the CR. Not a big deal, as I’m sure the rates team will provide feedback as well.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: We don’t do any special deals. They are free to use the existing vaults as they see fit.
g_dip:  Need? Definitely not my place to say, that’s @LongForWisdom    Informal poll, so @alexis you can do whatever makes sense to you. I don’t think you need to remove anything.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I think there is a “soft power diplomacy” play here – Yearn is a leading protocol and, to the extent we believe it possible and wise to encourage integrations and cross-protocol synergies, providing Yearn the vehicle can go far in (i) furthering that relationship, and (ii) opening the door to collaboration between the bustling communities. That’s why creating this special vault – presuming Yearn even wants it – makes sense. It’s not only the immediate benefit of relations among DeFi protocols, but also the long-term pollination among our teams.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
